uws.service

Class AbstractUWSFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • uws.service.AbstractUWSFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    UWSFactory

    public abstract class AbstractUWSFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements UWSFactory

    Abstract implementation of UWSFactory. Only the function which creates a JobThread from a UWSJob needs to be implemented.

    Version:
    4.1 (11/2014)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)

        protected final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,InputParamController> inputParamControllers

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractUWSFactory

        public AbstractUWSFactory()

      • AbstractUWSFactory

        public AbstractUWSFactory(java.lang.String[] expectedAdditionalParams)
        Builds a factory with a list of the name of all expected additional parameters. These parameters will be identified by UWSParameters without taking into account their case and they will stored with the case of their name in the given list.
        Parameters:
        expectedAdditionalParams - Names of the expected parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • createJob

        public UWSJob createJob(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
               JobOwner user)
                 throws UWSException
        Description copied from interface: UWSFactory
        Creates a (PENDING) UWS job from the given HTTP request.
        Specified by:
        createJob in interface UWSFactory
        Parameters:
        request - Request which triggers the creation of a UWS job.
        user - The identified UWS user (see UserIdentifier).
        Returns:
        The created job.
        Throws:
        UWSException - If there is an error while creating the job.

      • createJob

        public UWSJob createJob(java.lang.String jobID,
               JobOwner owner,
               UWSParameters params,
               long quote,
               long startTime,
               long endTime,
               java.util.List<Result> results,
               ErrorSummary error)
                 throws UWSException
        Description copied from interface: UWSFactory

        Creates a UWS job with the following attributes.

        • note1: This function is mainly used to restore a UWS job at the UWS initialization.
        • note2: The job phase is chosen automatically from the given job attributes (i.e. no endTime => PENDING, no result and no error => ABORTED, ...).
        Specified by:
        createJob in interface UWSFactory
        Parameters:
        jobID - ID of the job (NOT NULL).
        owner - Owner of the job.
        params - List of all input UWS job parameters.
        quote - Its quote (in seconds).
        startTime - Date/Time of the start of this job.
        endTime - Date/Time of the end of this job.
        results - All results of this job.
        error - The error which ended the job to create.
        Returns:
        The created job.
        Throws:
        UWSException - If there is an error while creating the job.

        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        fileManager - File manager to use if files are uploaded in an HTTP request.
        Returns:

        Throws:

      • addExpectedAdditionalParameter

        public final void addExpectedAdditionalParameter(java.lang.String paramName)
        Adds the name of an additional parameter which must be identified without taking into account its case and then stored with the case of the given name.
        Parameters:
        paramName - Name of an additional parameter.

      • getNbExpectedAdditionalParameters

        public final int getNbExpectedAdditionalParameters()
        Gets the number of additional parameters which must be identified with no case sensitivity.
        Returns:
        Number of expected additional parameters.

      • getExpectedAdditionalParameters

        public final java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getExpectedAdditionalParameters()
        Gets the names of the expected additional parameters. These parameters are identified with no case sensitivity and stored in the given case.
        Returns:
        Names of the expected additional parameters.

      • expectedAdditionalParametersIterator

        public final java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> expectedAdditionalParametersIterator()
        Gets an iterator on the names of the expected additional parameters.
        Returns:
        An iterator on the names of the expected additional parameters.

      • removeExpectedAdditionalParam

        public final void removeExpectedAdditionalParam(java.lang.String paramName)
        Removes the name of an expected additional parameter. This parameter will never be identify specifically and so, it will be stored in the same case as in the initial Map or HttpServletRequest.
        Parameters:
        paramName - Name of an additional parameter.

      • getInputParamController

        public final InputParamController getInputParamController(java.lang.String inputParamName)
        Gets the controller of the specified UWS input parameter.
        Parameters:
        inputParamName - Name of the parameter whose the controller must be returned.
        Returns:
        The corresponding controller or null if there is none.

      • setInputParamController

        public final InputParamController setInputParamController(java.lang.String paramName,
                                           InputParamController controller)
        Sets the controller of the specified input UWS job parameter.
        Parameters:
        paramName - Name of the parameter with which the given controller will be associated.
        controller - An input parameter controller.
        Returns:
        The former controller associated with the specified parameter or null if there is no controller before this call or if the given parameter name is null or an empty string.

      • removeInputParamController

        public final InputParamController removeInputParamController(java.lang.String paramName)
        Removes the controller of the specified input UWS job parameter.
        Parameters:
        paramName - Name of the parameter whose the controller must be removed.
        Returns:
        The removed controller or null if there were no controller or if the given name is null or an empty string.

      • configureExecution

        public final void configureExecution(long defaultDuration,
                      long maxDuration,
                      boolean allowModif)

        Lets configuring the execution duration default and maximum value.

        note: A new controller is created if needed. Otherwise the current one (if it is an instance of DestructionTimeController) is updated.

        Parameters:
        defaultDuration - Default duration between the start and the end of the execution of a job.
        maxDuration - Maximum duration between the start and the end of the execution of a job that a user can set when creating/initializing a job.
        allowModif - true to allow the modification of this parameter after its initialization, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        ExecutionDurationController

      • configureDestruction

        public final void configureDestruction(int defaultTime,
                        DestructionTimeController.DateField defaultTimeUnit,
                        int maxTime,
                        DestructionTimeController.DateField maxTimeUnit,
                        boolean allowModif)

        Lets configuring the destruction time default and maximum value.

        note: A new controller is created if needed. Otherwise the current one (if it is an instance of ExecutionDurationController) is updated.

        Parameters:
        defaultTime - Default time since the job creation and its destruction.
        defaultTimeUnit - Unit of the default time (i.e. minutes, days, ...).
        maxTime - Maximum time since the job creation and its destruction that a user can set when creating/initializing a job.
        maxTimeUnit - Unit of the maximum time (i.e. minutes, days, ...).
        allowModif - true to allow the modification of this parameter after its initialization, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        DestructionTimeController
